sentences.en: As things got worse at work, he began to use alcohol as a crutch.
sentences.cn: 工作每况愈下，他就开始借酒消愁。

sentences.en: Do you think what you need is a crutch?
sentences.cn: 你是否认为你需要一把拐杖?

sentences.en: Five hundred pounds and half the paperback right is a pretty solid crutch.
sentences.cn: 500镑再加上普及版权的收入,这可是大有所补了.

sentences.en: He gave up the crutch of alcohol.
He kicked him in the crutch.
Her religion was a crutch to her when John died.
sentences.cn: 约翰死后,她在精神上依靠宗教信仰支撑住自己.

sentences.en: His legs were cut off just below the crutch and he died at once.
sentences.cn: 他的双腿在齐根处被拦腰截断,立即死去.

sentences.en: However, most DDR players frown on this as a crutch.
sentences.cn: 然而, 大多数DDR玩 家都不喜欢使用这根拐杖.

sentences.en: I think he relies on alcohol as a crutch.
sentences.cn: 我想,他依赖于酒精作为精神支柱.

sentences.en: Illusion is a crutch for those with no grounding in reality.
sentences.cn: 在现实无法立足者,才会寻求幻影支撑.

sentences.en: Literature is a good crutch, but a very bad walking stick.
sentences.cn: 文学是好的拐杖, 却是坏的手杖.

sentences.en: My mother says that writing is a good crutch.
sentences.cn: 我妈说,搞写作不无小补.

sentences.en: Peter Carrington was a vital crutch in those early days abroad.
sentences.cn: 在早期外交事务中,彼得?卡灵顿是重要的依靠.

sentences.en: The calculator is a tool, not a crutch; yet it is increasingly being used as a crutch by many children.
sentences.cn: 计算器是工具，不是拐杖，可是现在很多孩子越来越依赖它。

sentences.en: The old sexton, leaning on a crutch, was taking the air at his cottage door.
sentences.cn: 那个年老的教堂管事,拄着一根拐杖, 正在他的家门口呼吸新鲜空气.

sentences.en: The patient has to hold firmly to her crutch when she's standing.
sentences.cn: 这个病人站着的时候必须紧紧抓住她的拐杖.

trans.tran_cn: 拐杖，支持物，精神上的寄托，胯部
trans.tran_en: one of a pair of long sticks that you put under your arms to help you walk when you have hurt your leg
